description: A British gentleman's innocent bride grapples with intrusive reminders of his deceased wife.
keywords: female nudity,female topless nudity,character name as series title,one word series title,forename as series title
name: Rebecca

review.name: To the commentator who mentioned it, the second Mrs. DeWinter had no first name
review.reviewBody: The second Mrs. DeWinter has no first name, and she was never given one for the film. Caroline DeWinter was the ancestor that the second Mrs. DeWinter dressed as for the costume ball. If this was not mentioned in the film, it should have been. It is mentioned in Alfred Hitchcock's masterful version of the book, by Dame Judith Anderson. Now, in context of the film, it was definitely closer to the book than Hitchcock's version (which you can blame David O. Selznick for the changes in the plot), and there is some very good acting, but it still seems like what it is, and that is a television film. Christopher Gunning provided a very emotional score though, with a heart wrenching theme for cello and orchestra.
